title: feat(quic): implement Packetization and Reliability (RFC 9000 §13)
body:
## RFC 9000 Section 13: Packetization and Reliability

### Overview
Implement packet validation, ACK generation, loss detection, and retransmission.

### Complexity: VERY HIGH (~2000 lines)
Core reliability layer with multiple components.

### Key Requirements

**Packet Processing:**
- Validate and discard invalid packets silently
- Process frames in order
- Track packet number spaces

**ACK Generation:**
- Immediate ACK for Initial/Handshake
- Delayed ACK for Application Data (max_ack_delay)
- ACK every 2 ack-eliciting packets
- ACK range compression

**Retransmission:**
- Frames retransmitted in new packets (not packet retransmission)
- Per-frame-type retry logic
- Integration with loss detection (RFC 9002)

**ECN:**
- Track ECT(0), ECT(1), CE counts
- Validate ECN functionality

### Implementation
**Files:**
- `include/quic/SocketQUICPacket.h`
- `src/quic/SocketQUICAck.c`
- `src/quic/SocketQUICLoss.c`

### Dependencies
- #384 (Section 12 - Packets and Frames)
- #382 (Section 17 - Packet Formats)
- #388 (Section 19.1-19.3 - ACK frames)

### Reference
- RFC 9002 for loss detection algorithms
